Metadata: Regulation of hepatic growth hormone receptors in coho salmon ("Oncorhynchus kisutch")

This report presents data from several experiments which suggest possible factors affecting hepatic growth hormones (GH) receptor levels in coho salmon. Effects of GH, thyroxine (T4), cortisol, insulin-like growth factor-I (IGF-I), and fasting on GH binding were examined. Inasmuch as fasting decreased hepatic GH binding, nutritional state as well as endogenous hormones may contribute to GH responsiveness in this teleost.
